required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electrical Impedance Tomography: Collapse in Dependent Areas as a Predictor of Response to Prone Position Ventilation in COVID-19 Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Electrical Impedance Tomography: Collapse in Dependent Areas as a Predictor of Response to Prone Position Ventilation in COVID-19 Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Direction Centrale du Service de Santé des Armées

clinical_study.source: Direction Centrale du Service de Santé des Armées

brief_summary.textblock:
There are several clinical presentations of SARS-CoV-2 infection. Among the severe forms, pulmonary involvement with respiratory failure is common. Although severe lung involvement with SARS-CoV-2 meets the Berlin criteria for Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS), it differs from classic ARDS in that compliance (reflecting distensibility of the lung parenchyma) is frequently preserved.
If the interest of Electrical Impedance Tomography has been demonstrated in classical ARDS, this is not the case in ARDS with COVID-19.
However, the use of this technique in this particular patient population would make it possible to distinguish patients with severe hypoxemia linked to derecruitment from those without derecruitment, in whom hypoxemia is more likely to be linked to the loss of hypoxic vasoconstriction.

primary_outcome.measure: Coefficient of correlation between the percentage of derecruitment of dependent areas (measured with Electrical Impedance Tomography) and the response to prone position
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of derecruitment of dependent areas will be measured every day with Electrical Impedance Tomography. The response to prone position will be assessed every day.

intervention.description: Electrical Impedance tomography recording during 5 minutes every day during 7 days

study_pop.textblock: The study population is composed of patients who have been admitted to the intensive care unit for SARS-CoV-2 ARDS.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to the intensive care unit for SARS-CoV-2 ARDS
- Under controlled invasive ventilation for less than 7 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pneumothorax
- Deformation of the rib cage
- Contraindication to Electrical Impedance Tomography
- Pregnant or breastfeeding woman
